items.content_html:
Summary

I removed unnecessary information, shorted some texts, and changed the order of information in a few parts of this article.

Motivation

Actually, I started reading the articles and wondered about the order of information in the two outer display type lists. I wanted to align the order of information. Then, I continued reading because I wanted to learn about and understand the different box models.

I read a lot of text that was not needed which made it hard to understand the content. When I came to the alternative CSS box model, I decided that it would be better to reorder the existing information.

Shorter sentences and using active voice will help readers to understand the content better.

Questions

It's kind of unclear to me when the content should just describe, use "you", and when to use "we" - but I managed it somehow :) Is there a guide on this?

Supporting details

none

Related issues

none

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Improve and simplify texts and fix minor issues
fix: Markdownlint spacing and Q tag

items.content_html:
** do not merge until all manifest V3 content is ready **

Summary

MV3 background event pages updates, including:

  • adding a new background script page to describe the content of a background script and how to convert persistent scripts to non-persistent
  • modified the anatomy of a web extension page to remove information moved to the new background script page and updated the more informational link.
  • updated the background manifest key page revising the more information link and clarifying the required and optional properties.
  • updated more information links for background scripts to point to the new page on the content script page.
  • updated menus.create to note that it requires ID when using mv3 or event pages in mv2
  • added deprecation flags and notes for extension.lastError, extension.getBackgroundPage, and runtime.getBackgroundPage

Metadata

items.content_html:
Ref: https://www.w3.org/TR/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcstatstype-track

Summary

Notice to developers the track RTCStatsType is deprecated and moved to media-source, sender, outbound-rtp, receiver, and inbound-rtp.

Motivation

Because can confuse devs and they could use this RTCStatsType in production which is not recommended.

Supporting details

https://www.w3.org/TR/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcstatstype-track

Related issues

items.content_html:
Summary

  • Adds documentation for the Document.createAttributeNS DOM interface (and "see also" links)
  • Small grammar fix in Document.createAttribute
  • Small improvements to Document.createElementNS: fix broken link (I hope) and add possible exceptions.

Motivation

Though I guess rarely used over Element.setAttributeNS, this seems to be a core part of the DOM spec, defined with createAttribute.

Supporting details

Based on the existing documentation for Document.createAttribute and Document.createElementNS.

I've never created a page before, so I'm not sure whether I need to do something to get the Specifications or Browser compatibility to work. Or to get a crosslink back from the DOM spec.

Related issues

  • Adds a new document

  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Document.createAttributeNS

items.content_html:
Fixes #15523

I tested the behaviour and checked the spec.

  • If the port is not set, URL.port is set to ''.
  • If the port is set to the default scheme, URL.port is also set to ''.
  • If the port is et, and not to the default for the scheme, URL.port is set to the port number given.

This PR adapts the original description that was wrong, and adds 2 examples.
items.title: Update URL.port

items.content_html:
Summary

Rephrase the ordering of arguments of comparison to make it easier to understand. Now it reads like:

  • If the result is greater than zero, it means a is greater than b and hence, a comes after b.
  • If the result is less than zero, it means a is less than b and hence, a comes before b.

Motivation

Improve readability.

items.title: Rephrase the ordering of arguments of comparison

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR adds content about HIDDevice.forget, SerialPort.forget, USBDevice.forget.

Motivation

BCD already contains data about these interfaces, they either already shipped or are being shipped in Chrome soon, so it makes sense to document them as well.

Supporting details

  • USB: shipped in Chrome 101
    • Testing steps
    • Chrome status
  • SerialPort: will ship in Chrome 103
    • Chrome status
    • Intent to ship
  • HIDDevice: shipped in Chrome 100
    • Chrome status

Related issues

mdn/browser-compat-data#15587
mdn/browser-compat-data#15920
mdn/browser-compat-data#15597

items.content_html:
Fixes #15212.

@S-Bowen , I have tried to clarify the syntax for repeat() in this PR. It's a little tricky because for properties we use formal syntax (e.g. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/grid-template-columns#formal_syntax) which, although hard to understand, is precise. But we don't use formal syntax in the functional notation pages (for reasons) and probably won't for the forseeable future.

So I've used words instead to try to explain. I think this page would also be improved by some more complex examples, but maybe we could make that a follow-up.

Let me know what you think!
items.title: Clarify repeat() syntax

items.content_html:
Summary

Adding this value brings the MDN docs into alignment with the chrome documentation it's derived from. The chrome code/documentation was recently updated to include "fuchsia".

Motivation

The value was recently added in chromium and it's good to keep MDN up to date.
items.title: Add "fuchsia" as one of the possible values

items.content_html:
Another test for GlobalEventHandlers.

WebIDL:

partial interface mixin GlobalEventHandlers {
  attribute EventHandler onselectstart;
  attribute EventHandler onselectionchange;
};

Document includes GlobalEventHandlers
Window includes GlobalEventHandlers
HTMLElement includes GlobalEventHandlers
MathMLElement includes GlobalEventHandlers
SVGElement includes GlobalEventHandlers

Before this PR, there were these 6 pages:

  • Web/API/GlobalEventHandlers/onselectionchange
  • Web/API/GlobalEventHandlers/onselectstart
  • Web/API/Document/selectionchange_event
  • Web/API/Document/selectstart_event
  • Web/API/HTMLInputElement/selectionchange_event
  • Web/API/HTMLTextAreaElement/selectionchange_event

Now there are these 2 pages:

  • Web/API/GlobalEventHandlers/selectionchange_event
  • Web/API/GlobalEventHandlers/selectstart_event
items.title: Combine docs for selection events under GlobalEventHandlers

items.content_html:
This is a PR to discuss how to document events that are defined as GlobalEventHandlers.

Spec: https://immersive-web.github.io/dom-overlays/#onbeforexrselect

WebIDL:

partial interface mixin GlobalEventHandlers {
  attribute EventHandler onbeforexrselect;
};

Document includes GlobalEventHandlers
Window includes GlobalEventHandlers
HTMLElement includes GlobalEventHandlers
MathMLElement includes GlobalEventHandlers
SVGElement includes GlobalEventHandlers

If we would avoid the GlobalEventHandlers mixin, then the specific interfaces for the beforexrselect event would be Document, Window, HTMLElement, MathMLElement, SVGElement. I think it makes no sense to create pages under all these interfaces. So, here I'm instead creating a single page beforexrselect_event under GlobalEventHandlers along with a section on the page called "Event availability". The title of the page is just 'beforexrselect event' without an interface.

In BCD, the data would live in api.GlobalEventHandlers.beforexrselect_event. See mdn/browser-compat-data#16026
items.title: Document global beforexrselect event
